name: dactylic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to refer to a rhythm in poetry in which one strong or long syllable is followed by two unstressed (= not strong) or short syllables: The word "elephant" demonstrates a dactylic stress pattern. Compare
iambic
spondaic
trochaic
More examplesFewer examplesIambic rhythms are described as "ascending" because they ascend from a low to a high level of stress, while trochaic and dactylic rhythms are "descending."He argues that English dactylic verse uses dactyls very irregularly.The pattern here is known as a dactyl (- ..) and these are dactylic feet.She recognised Shostakovich's incessant dactylic rhythms.
